result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Henry Racinowski Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's name. 
No drug paraphernalia. 
No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose. 
Defendant to comply with any other conditions, assessments, and/or rules per Agent.
Defendant to maintain full time employment in an occupation approved by Agent and not voluntarily quit employment without Agent's approval.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Face Sheet Intake and Investigation and fax confirmation to Sparta Probation

Defendant Robert Henry Racinowski Jr. in court.  Attorney Craig Gericke in court for Robert Henry Racinowski Jr.  Attorney Crystal Long in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest and is found guilty of count 1. 3 yrs probation with conditions. 6 months jail. 191 days sentence credit.
Jail Confinement Card

Defendant Robert Henry Racinowski Jr. appeared by video.  Attorney Craig Gericke appeared by video for Robert Henry Racinowski Jr.  Attorney Skiles appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond regarding BMP/GPS House Arrest. Defendant has been compliant. Attorney states that they have a resolution. Plea/Sentencing date to be scheduled. Motion is denied. Can move up plea/sentencing hearing.

Bond Monitoring Compliance Report

Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed to drive in Wisconsin.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM FOR "RESTRICTED TO RESIDENCE" PURPOSES ONLY. 
DEFENDANT MUST GO IMMEDIATELY TO THE JUSTICE PROGRAMS OFFICE UPON SIGNING OF BOND AND/OR RELEASE.  
THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM IS LOCATED IN THE MONROE COUNTY JUSTICE CENTER AT 112 SOUTH COURT STREET, ROOM 1008, SPARTA, WI. 
DEFENDANT MUST BE EQUIPPED WITH A GPS DEVICE THROUGH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM. 
***DEFENDANT TO BE RESTRICTED TO RESIDENCE DETERMINED BY JUSTICE DEPT AND IS NOT ALLOWED TO LEAVE THEIR RESIDENCE EXCEPT FOR WORK, TREATMENT, TESTING PURPOSES, OR EXCEPTIONS APPROVED BY BOND MONITORING PROGRAM, AND ONLY IF APPROVED IN ADVANCE.
DEFENDANT NOT REQUIRED TO TEST.
